The course had extra credit and assignments/exams were easy if you read the book. Easiest class that I had all semester. Switched my major after taking this course!

summary_comment: Professor Kim at Ohio State is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and fairness. She ensures students understand the material thoroughly, and the midterm exam was noted as very fair with a high average score. The course content is considered minimal, with exams closely aligned to the slideshows used in lectures.

Ratings.comment: Professor Kim was new this year to Ohio State. I can't say enough for how great she was. She made sure you knew what you were doing. The midterm exam was very fair. The avg was very high. I treated this course as an elementary stats class to be quite honest as there is very little material and exams come straight from slideshow (common knowledge)

summary_comment: Scott is an exceptional professor known for his passion and dedication to his students' success. He sets high standards and provides valuable, constructive feedback, though the workload can be demanding. Students appreciate his approachable nature and commitment to helping them achieve their goals.

Ratings.comment: Scott is amazing. He may seem like a tough guy who its hard to get a read on, but he genuinely cares about students. If you go to his office hours he gives great feedback. He is also incredibly sympathetic to personal issues outside of class. As long as you show him you are trying, he will help you in any way he can. Great human and teacher.

Biggest portion of this class is the online sim, which was honestly fun, and there are 2 group projects associated with the sim. The first was harder than the second but I advise you to go to office hours because he was able to guide & help my group! There's a homework assignment due each week that I recommend not procrastinating- put work into it!

Scott is an incredible professor who truly cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He's passionate about marketing & a great teacher with a ton of experience. He's a tough grader, but it's only bc he has a high standard for our work, and I think that's really respectable. Go to his office hours; he gives great feedback!

way too much work outside of the class, also he doesn't grade too tough, just about everything you do with be in the 87-92 range, but makes it exceedingly difficult to score outside of this range, doesn't really believe in giving A's or 100% on anything, does not provide feedback for his grading either.
Scott is a great professor

Scott is by far the best Fisher prof! Funny+relatable guy, makes lectures interesting/disc based. Disc posts due before class relate to that class so you're already prepared to participate. This was a new course but I really enjoyed it, teaches you a lot that you don't learn in other mktg classes. Make sure you choose a good group in the beginning!

Scott is one of the best lecturers at the Fisher College. He is passionate, enthusiastic and cares about providing students with the best classroom experience possible. His classes are more discussion-based rather than lecture, and he has a great sense of humor. He has high expectations but is always willing to offer good feedback.

Scott is a great professor that really wants everyone to get real experiences out of his classes. For Marketing Projects 4204, you only have group meetings with him for 25 minutes per week, the rest is on the group to prepare to deliver their project at the end of the semester. He encourages coming to his office and is quick to reply to emails.

So I have now had Scott for 3 classes, so I know him pretty well. Scott is one of the harder graders. He has high expectations which make it hard to get a perfect score, but provides great feedback. He will go out of his way to help any of his students if you meet with him! Bad Group  Bad Grade, unless you tear apart your group in the evaluation.

Scott at first seemed like he would be a very good professor and give you a chance to learn while also receiving a good grade. This ended up not being the case at all. He was very unorganized for his classes and constantly behind on grading. His grading also was very opinion based and he believed a 100% isn't possible. Do not take him.

Class is heavily based on two group projects, so having a good group is vital to getting a good grade, even if you participate every class, which is also a component of the class grading structure.  If you are a part of a group where procrastination is a common theme, you will have a difficult time doing well on the projects.  I was disappointed.

Scott is the man!  Let me be clear: Scott has pretty strict expectations of students in his classes - no cell phones, show up (on time), and participate.  Other than that, he provides an environment where you really feel like you're learning rather than being talked down to.  He's got a decent sense of humor and kept the course fun & challenging.

One of the best professors I have had in Fisher and my college career. Class is not hard but it is a class you definitely walk out of and feel you learned something. Rather than a class you feel like you just learned info for an exam. Scott genuinely cares about his students and the marketing field. Would recommend his classes to anyone.
He would assign readings from the textbook and use that as the basis of discussion in class. Most of the material was repetitive of 4201. Easy class and no tests, just a couple of case write-ups.

Scott was a fun lecturer although the material was review of the many marketing classes we've already taken. Nothing new. Need the book because of the cases, but nothing else-try sharing with someone. He takes attendance randomly & sounds like he uses it for attendance grades.

summary_comment: Claire is highly regarded as a passionate and caring professor who genuinely helps her students succeed both academically and professionally. Her classes are described as engaging and beneficial, though they require significant effort, particularly through detailed quizzes and exams. Students appreciate her fair grading, insightful feedback, and the practical, real-world applications of her courses.

Ratings.comment: Claire has a deep passion for marketing and helping her students, if you put in the effort this course is so much fun and fairly simple. Claire rocks and these reviews are so mean.

Claire was a great professor, truly cared about her students & always gave insightful meaningful feedback. I will say there is a lot of work, however it was all very informative and useful. By far one of the most beneficial classes I took in college. Also Claire is very knowledgable, & I loved learning from her. Really recommend taking this course!

not sure why Claire has all these bad reviews, I'm assuming she changed her Digital Marketing class because its mostly group work and activities. Quizzes are closed note but only 10 questions and combined 10% of your grade. She is funny and passionate about marketing and I am learning a lot from her class. It's fun and many grades are easy points.
she is a nice person but her quizzes and exams are hard, she puts questions that are very detailed and written somewhere in the textbook.

The homework assignments and reading the text do nothing to help detailed quuestions and exams, which are 60% of your grade by the way. 60 detailed questions on exams and homework does nothing to help.

Claire is an incredible professor, and by far the most caring professor I have had at Ohio State. She wants you to succeed in the class, but more importantly, she wants you to succeed in your career. She communicates the material well, provides great life advice, and she grades very fairly. Put the work into this class and you will be golden!

This class is a semester long group project, where you meet with Claire once a week for ~25 mins. Some of the weekly assignments take a long time to complete, so don't procrastinate! She gives great feedback & going to office hours will really set your team apart. Put in the work, come prepared with questions, and you'll be set for success.
One group project, served in consulting role for a business, fun real world class that i think was one of the best to prepare me for an actual career

I had a great experience with Claire as a teacher for BUSML 4204. She cares a lot about her student's success but expects a lot of effort from them. She gives critical feedback, but only as a means to make your end project the best it can be. Ask as many questions as possible and put in the work and you're bound to be successful in her course.

The way this class is designed is abhorrent. The homework assignments and reading the text do nothing to help prepare for the proctored quizzes (and exams, which are 60% of your grade by the way). The readings/assignments are vague and chock-full of definitions that all sound the same and the exams, 65 questions each, are mostly definition based.

Quizzes are proctored and more than 200 terms each, and there's essentially one every week. Exams and quizzes are difficult and lectures and readings don't help to prepare you at all. Claire does very little to help you and relies on having the textbook teach. One of those professors who believe that their class is the only one you're taking.

I had Claire for 3250 and she is my favorite professor in Fisher so far. 

Do not miss lectures, or else you will miss key information for the tests. The tests can be difficult... don't expect to do well if you don't prepare. But the class offers a 5% extra credit if you attend marketing studies which makes an A in the class very achievable.

Worst classes, Worst Teacher. Had a meeting with her right before the final and she told me that she is aware that most kids understand the materials but fail the test. However she wont change the exam format. Exams are 60% of your grade. She doesnt care about you at all but claims she does. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!! Find another teacher. Terrible!!!

I have never received a B in any course before this one. And I worked harder than I ever have in any other class to try to get an A. You do 8 assignments a week plus hours of reading textbook chapters and taking notes on them, all for none of it to be on the exams. Why make us study the chapters when we will get asked the most random things on test

I was scared to take her because of her reviews, but she honestly was a great professor. The exams are based on her lectures, and the other assignments are based on the textbook. There are a lot of chapters to know but if you watch her lectures and take notes you will do fine in the class. I would take her again.

Claire was a wonderful professor to have for marketing projects! She cares a ton about her students and wanted to give her time and guidance throughout the semester to ensure success in the class. She responds to emails quickly and was willing to review our presentation over Thanksgiving break, even though she didn't have to.

I would not take this course again. The class is much more work than it's worth. She has an outrageous policy where if u miss 1 assignment you cannot receive an A in her class. Her tests cover 1-9 chapters at a time with no study guide at all and are proctored so you need to memorize everything (65 questions in 80 min). DO NOT TAKE ONLINE.
Professor Adams covered a lot of material, but it was all relevant and she made sure to bring it back to the real world. Felt like I could actually use stuff she taught in a job in marketing.

She seems really nice but DONT take the online class. She has it set up in a lazy format because she clearly doesnt want to hold zooms for the online lectures. She turned all the online classes into asynchronous and just records one of her in persons and posts it but the audio is horrible and unbearable to watch. Beware.

I love claire so much! she has been my favorite professor at OSU so far. she made lectures and class very engaging. assignments were not difficult however, they did require time to receive a good grade. she had guest speakers come in and speak to our class about their real-world marketing knowledge. the class had the opportunity for 5% extra credit

Her class isnt hard but shes quite literally unreachable outside of class, which is unacceptable in my opinion when youre teaching an entirely virtual class. Luckily her class is easy, but I emailed her three different times during the semester and never got a response. If you expect to communicate with your professors, dont take her class.

I felt like I learned a lot from Professor Adams. She truly cares about her students succeeding and she shows it, especially in a live setting. Not the usual blow-off work you would see in a Fisher class, but it's good to actually learn something from the class for a change. I'd rather take her class that one where I skate by and don't learn.

Overall this class seemed like it was a lot harder than it needed to be. There was so much reading and so many assignments each week, it felt excessive for a business core class. Definitely do all the extra credit, it is worth 5% and really boosts your grade. The final was impossible to study for, over 22 chapters, had to curve 8%.

Her first year at OSU, so it's understandable that she's still learning, but I was surprised by the lack of professionalism. The homework is extremely time consuming. Her exams have little to do with the homework. The exams are cumulative and proctored. It took another teacher to convince her to accommodate for an exam conflict. Rude over email.

This class is mostly book work, which is time-consuming but easy. Exams ruin the class. You're expected to know material from 22 chapters of the textbook for a closed-note exam. Nothing even remotely resembling a study guide is offered. 90-minute lectures aren't enough to summarize a full chapter, but you're expected to memorize 20+. Good luck.

Extra credit 5% and lots of points from a ton of book assignments which is time consuming but nice. If you complete all of that its easy to get at least a B. However the exams are ridiculous, the final covers 22 chapters closed note, and the lectures are vague. Praying she curves the final.

This class was horrible. Avoid this professor at all costs. So much homework every week that wasnt even applicable to the exams. She made lectures wayyyyy too long when they shouldnt have been and had way too much information loaded in. She also automatically discounts you from an A if you miss an assignment. Exams were cumulative and proctored.

Her 1st semester at OSU, understand but clearly shows. Huge amount of busywork that rarely translated to exams and felt like it was there she didn't have to grade anything herself. Very unclear about what content to study for exams and exams were very inconsistent with what was focused on during class. Final exam is 100 questions 100 minutes. Yucky

Unclear on what to study exactly for exams, Too much information to do in a weeks worth along with 5 other classes. Workload for this class is more of a 4-5 Credit hour course, This was this teachers first semester at Ohio State so of course we got the worst of it, Take a different professor for this course

Her first semester as a Prof at OSU. Really dry lectures that are recorded, with lots of out of class work compared to other marketing professors. Extra credit up to 5% which is pretty easy to do. Mini simulations that are some of the worst assignments that you will do while in the business school.

summary_comment: Professor Deng is generally well-regarded, with students noting her care and fairness in grading, though some find her lectures somewhat boring. The class is described as relatively easy, with a significant portion of the grade coming from group assignments and exams that closely follow lecture material. While there are mixed opinions, many recommend taking her for Consumer Behavior.

Ratings.comment:
Very nice professor! For the most part does a great job teaching. There is a decent amount of reading that is needed outside of class, as this content will be on the exams. Content is also quite interesting. 

Good class and good professor.
Professor Deng is super nice. The group papers and projects are really easy if you have a good group. Her exams are long but not that difficult, I would suggest to take her for consumer behavior.

Professor Deng, is very caring. The class itself is pretty easy just know the verbatim for the exams and you will be fine. Her lectures are long and kind of boring, but she is the best out of all the 4201 professors. Take 4201 with her I learned a lot and most importantly I felt like she set us up for success.
Her lecture is very very boring...

EXTREMELY easy class. Half of the grade are in gimme group assignments that are graded on effort and following instructions.  She gives exam reviews that contain 2 - 4 questions that will be on the exam.  Did not need textbook at all (there are maybe 2 - 3 questions per exam from book, easy to figure out).  Wording on exam is fuzzy but manageable.

Dr. Deng is great.  You have 5 assignments that account for half of your grade, and she is a very fair and lenient grader on them as long as you put in the effort.  Attendance is not mandatory, but if you go to class it will pay off in the end.  Exams are a little tough, but study the notes (no need for text) and you will be fine. Take Her!

This professor is terrible. If you have the option, take someone else. She does not explain anything clearly and will send an e-mail to you the day before a presentation is due  to tell you that you have a presentation to do! The class has potential to be VERY interesting, but she rips that away from the subject completely.

summary_comment: Professor Bunker excelled in her first semester teaching BUSADM 3640.02, delivering a highly effective course focused on sustainable business practices through engaging speaker talks. She is noted for her caring approach and fair grading standards.

Ratings.comment: This was Professor Bunker's first semester teaching BUSADM 3640.02 and she did a fantastic job! The course primarily focused on applications of sustainability in the business world through a series of speaker talks which were always insightful and engaging. Professor Bunker also really cares about her students and grades fairly.

summary_comment: Professor Namaky offers clear, well-organized slides and straightforward exams that closely follow the lectures, making the class easy to navigate. However, his tendency to report students to academic authorities and his rambling lectures have led many to advise against taking his class, despite the potential for extra credit and point adjustments. Attendance is mandatory.

Ratings.comment: Don't take him if you don't wait to deal with coam bs. he literally reported half of the class to coam and now we are all unhappy. save your sanity and don't take him, even if the class is really easy.

Professor Namaky has super clear and direct slides that are prepared and well organized. His exams come straight from the lecture so easy to follow and offers extra credit and often added a few points back after an exam/quiz. Does more than just read directly from the slides but ever rambles during lectures. Attendance is required.

summary_comment: This professor is highly dedicated and passionate about the subject matter, making her lectures engaging and interesting. However, exams can be challenging and heavily weighted, requiring significant preparation. Despite the difficulty, she is known for being personable, reachable, and fair in her grading, often curving exams and offering extra credit opportunities.

Ratings.comment: She was a fantastic professor. You can tell she's really dedicated to the content and her students. Overall, not too bad of a class with engaging lectures. Exams were a bit tricky but she curves them a few points and curved the class at the end as well!

Consumer Behavior BUSML4201 - Favorite class at OSU by far; great and well thought out lectures with engaging examples. Fun group projects and not a lot of outside work. If you pay attention in lecture exams are not bad - she is very personable

Absolutely take advantage of the extra credit opportunities given to you. You can earn up to 5% of extra credit and it definitely comes in handy at the end of the semester. My exams were online and proctored, and decently difficult. Easy homework every week, but exams are not the best. Prof is nice though.

Very organized and involved lectures. You can tell she loves teaching marketing and made the online lectures bearable to watch. The exams are fair, doing the study guide and rewatching the lectures really helped me however, the questions can be a little tricky. She is a very solid choice for intro marketing.
Hard exams.

Class is hard for no reason. Mid-term wasn't bad, but the final was absolutely ridiculous considering I spent more time studying for the final than the mid-term. Extra credit is offered, but you can only get it if you're in person though it is an ONLINE class. No correlation to the book whatsoever. I'd rather die than take it again
Incredible professor and very passionate about the subject. Incredibly reachable. Class heavily weighted towards exams. Everything is multiple-choice, but exams are tricky. Overall, fair class.

Dr. Reczek is really sweet and she cares a lot about the material. The lectures were pretty interesting, they were just long, and since it was an online format, long online videos feel even longer. Not her fault though. The class was straight forward. I would recommend.

Online classes are still classes. If you put off the work, you will not do well. Watch lectures every week, do the online assignments, use the study guide, and you'll do fine on the exams. She asks some tricky questions but that's college. Do the extra credit studies early. Reczek explains things clearly and tries to make class interesting.

Dr. Reczek is a very knowledgeable lecturer and I learned a lot from her. Her exams were very fair. If you fill out the study guides, review them and look over the chapter quizzes, you should be fine. Don't expect to ace the exams without studying. Make sure to do the extra credit to maximize your final grade.

Gives you over one hundred terms to know for the final (excluding all the terms you had to know for the midterm, which was probably over 100 as well) even though its only 55 questions. Online work is extremely stupid and does not teach you anything. Very long readings before you do the online work that will take hours. Not an enjoyable class.
Exams were absolutely insane and worth the majority of your grade. Would not recommend taking her.

Really a good professor. Make sure you doing the weekly HW, and pay more attention to the quiz, since problems in the quiz are simialr to the mutiple choices in midterm and final. Also, make sure you go to the lec to take notes, since there are some contents on the slide that are not included in the textbook but will appear on the tests.

Exams are insanely hard and questions are purposefully deceptive. The wording of the questions is so complicated that she allows you to bring a dictionary to the exam. The rest of the course was easy, but the exams are a massive roadblock. Beware of this

I personally think Rebecca is a great professor. She explains everything very well and organizes the class good and tells you exactly what you need to do. There are weekly assignments and readings and if you do them youll do well
Lots of homework but it prepares you extremely well for the exams and teaches you the material. Weekly to-do assignments and she explains harder concepts well. Great class!

Dr. Reczek is awesome!! She is super easy to get ahold of via email if you have any questions and puts up very helpful study guides for the midterm and final. You can also earn up to 10 extra credit points by just signing up to participate in marketing research studies. The material is not bad at all and the class is very fair.

Reczek essentially just presents the information from the textbook, but her exams are fair and she gives a lot of extra credit opportunities. I went to lecture because it was convenient but it wasn't that helpful and you could probably do just as well by studying on your own.

Weekly assignments (quiz, homeowork, simulation) on Pearson that aren't difficult if you use/read the textbook chapters, she gives study guide for the midterm and final, and you can get up to 10 extra credit points by participating in research studies so I advise you grab spots quick and try to do the online ones, which make for easy extra credit

A lot of the point in the class goes to the weekly quizzes, exercises and assessments on Pearson. You have to read before taking the assessments. You should do well in the class if you do all the Pearson exercises that she assigns each week.  She gives a study guide for each exam (2) and that is very useful.
The online version of 3150 is pretty cut and dry, read a chapter a week then take an few online quizes as your main grades. The exams are just memorization, so the class should just be an easy A.

Dr. Reczek knows how to teach Marketing well. Her passion for the class is shown through her many real world examples and her care for her students. Exams can be a little tough so make sure to study up, but if you do, you will be fine, as they are fair.
This class is unfortunately long but Reczek somehow manages to make it interesting and relevant.  Went to every class and enjoyed the material she covered.

summary_comment: Professor Soster is highly regarded for her laid-back and personal teaching style, offering fair tests that require diligent study. She is known for her clarity in grading criteria and content, making lectures both enjoyable and informative despite mandatory attendance. Her consistent focus on clear communication about exam content and provision of thorough test review notes further enhances her overall teaching quality.

Ratings.comment: A very laid-back and personal professor. Tests are very fair -- though you will have to put time into studying for them.

Soster is a great teacher and has very clear grading criteria for everything. She is super fair, and the content she teaches is interesting. She is super upbeat and cracks jokes all the time, so lectures are actually enjoyable even though attendance is mandatory. She gives great test review notes and is very clear about what is going to be on exams

summary_comment: The professor's teaching quality is mixed; while students appreciate occasional career advice, they find his commentary inconsistent. Despite the course being quite easy, many recommend seeking an alternative instructor if possible.

Ratings.comment: This professor is nothing amazing. At times he gives helpful career advice and then other times he is using odd commentary. His class is super easy but I would try to take this course with another professor if you can!

summary_comment: The professor is perceived as lacking engagement with course management tools and communication, and he promotes questionable research and reporting practices. Despite the project-based nature of the course, his involvement appears superficial, given his primary role as an external consultant.

Ratings.comment: This dude is a donut. 4204 is projects, so you don't need a great professor, but he doesn't know how to work carmen, has never answered an email, and encourages us to use improper research and reporting practices in the name of being more convincing to the client. He's also a consultant outside of class, so this is an afterthought to him.

summary_comment: Professor Curtis emphasizes learning over grading, making his exams relatively easy and not strict on grading. However, his lectures are often considered unhelpful due to tangential content and reliance on online slides, necessitating self-study of the textbook. Despite this, students appreciate his care for their well-being.

Ratings.comment: Curtis cares more about what you learn rather than grades. His exams are pretty easy and he is not a tough grader. With that being said, his lectures are not helpful as he gets off topic in every one and he just reads off the slides in his online videos. There's really no way around reading the textbook. He does care about his students tho.

His lectures are exceptionally pointless, you will still have to watch online lectures, hours of tedtalks, and write discussion posts. Exams are pulled directly from quizlet's so study those. Once i found those I got 100% on every exam. Also have a 15 page paper that just requires effort.

This class consists of the option between weekly discussion posts or a 15 page paper due at the end of the semester, weekly quizzes, and a few exams. Curtis lectures about random things instead of the actual graded material during lectures, while also pushing questionable political narratives within the course material.

A lot of people who don't like this class are people who like being spoon-fed their education. Haugtvedt is extremely intelligent and chooses to focus on more real life examples in lectures. I learned soft skills of critical thinking and drawing my own conclusions from the text/ news about marketing and CB. Don't take this class for granted!

Specifically for branch campus students, he is the absolute worst. He doesnt care about the other campuses at all. Your grade depends one one group project that hell give little feedback for. Its required though, so best of luck

He uses class time to discuss anecdotes from his personal life/family/students problems without relating it to course material. The final/only exam is over the book and slides which we don't use except for them being available on carmen. You have to read/study the material on your own in order to learn about public policy or social marketing.

Easiest class ever taken discussion posts but have whole semester to complete Everyone tries really hard on the first few and write novels Wait a few weeks in and people will be writing less Even replies count eightteenpage paper but b s ing works Presentation but you can do it online Exams must watch videos questions worded easy easiest a

Tests are so easy just read over the slides and know definitions from book (only 3 exams). Instead of class on Friday he has "Internet Friday" where he posts videos for you to watch. Requires 3 discussion posts a week (don't procrastinate). Only downside is the 18 page paper. Lectures are basically him telling stories about his life. No homework.

Class is almost entirely based off of Ted talks and his own anecdotes. Interesting guy who obviously cares a lot about consumer behavior but has little actual teaching ability mainly due to the fact that he is constantly cancelling class.

This class includes participation, 45 discussion posts, 3 exams, and an 18-20 page APA style paper. Don't procrastinate on discussion posts, exams almost exclusively cover bolded definitions from the book and class PPTs, and the paper is over a topic of your choice (easy grader). Professor Curtis is a very nice, caring, and knowledgeable teacher.

If you are interested in going through 5 minutes of slides during class & then discussing current events or his/other students personal & often unrelated experiences, take Curts class. It is a cakewalk, but you learn little to nothing about what you're supposed to be learning. 15-20 page paper at the end of the semester he definitely doesnt read

Not a bad instructor overall.  Nice guy, good lecturer.  Canceled our Friday class so it was just Monday Tuesday each week.  But in its place you have to write 3 discussion posts a week (kinda a lot - gets annoying)  There is a 15 - 20 page paper for the final, but you get to choose the topic so it is not completely terrible.

Good teacher, learned a lot. He stands up there and talks about advertising in general and doesn't really teach you about the notes. DON'T buy the book. The notes he posts on Carmen are all you really need to study for the two tests. 3 discussion posts per week and Friday videos instead of class plus a 10 page paper that was on an advertising topic

No friday class for all his classes. Instead, you'll have internet friday to post discussions. Boring  lecture, just watch videos. Really nice personality!  May get so so  scores on the exam, but your overall grade will look good.

Pro. Curt is my mentor at OSU! Had 3 of his classes and all got A. Paper required but page limit is not strict. 8 is fine for a 10-page paper. Pictures are allowed. Reading is preferred for exam. Very approachable. Had a mental break down last semester and he talked with me on the phone for 1 hour!  You can visit his office just to chat.
World authority on Consumer Behavior. Very personable and easy to approach.  Concerned for students' understanding of the topic and its impact in the real world.

Very rarely have I came across a class that was as relevant and meaningful, and goes beyond just book theories like his class. Really  great class to take if you want to learn instead of just memorize useless information to get by.

The most "engaging" professor I've had at OSU. He actually talks to you, not at you. He piques interest using relevant topics for discussions. The textbook he assigned is incredibly relevant. This isn't a fake post… I just loved the class. The tests were easy if you study the terminology from the book. Big paper at the end, but it was fun to write.

I was longing to take this course but he really failed my high expectation. He barely talks about any of the info thats from the textbook which would be on the exam, and spends a lot of time on watching videos in class.

Easy as pie class that's actually really interesting. For the exams, Don't bother with the slides (as he never goes over them), just study the definitions in the book and you'll ace the class. Essay paper is a bit long, but really that hard if you know how to write and have a lot of references (which is not hard with online stuff)
He doesn't follow the notes or the textbook. Just shows videos and leads pointless, unproductive discussions. Don't need the book. He makes you write a 10-20 page paper. Not a worthwhile class.
Curt is a good professor and a good person.  He talks to the class like an old friend and goes off on tangents that are ofttimes much more interesting than the notes.  Highly recommended.
extremely easy professor n class! I learned alot from him
Favorite teacher at Fisher! He actually talked about things that MATTER and doesn't ramble about nonsense in textboos all day.

He's super chill and very personable. He'll go out of his way to help you out and always treats his students as equals. Class is never boring and he's extremely lenient about grades. There's really nothing more to say. He's and nice guy and I wish more professors were like him. Take him. You won't regret it.
The best teacher I've had at Ohio State.  Loves what he teaches and more than willing to help and give advice.  100& Recommend.
Nice guy and easy A
Great professor! He loves what he's teaching!  Class is fairly easy but you MUST read the book as some of his test questions come directly from it.  Overall great class!  :)

Very easy professor.  Classes were mostly him just talking about his research or trips to China.  If you're interested in Consumer Behavior you probably won't learn a whole lot from this class.  Also he's huge on busy work ... papers, etc.
Really easy class. 3 Exams multiple choice, very obvious answers. Group or individual project. I did it by myself, got an A. Curves class even though it's unnecessary. Really nice and always helpful!
Huge group assignment - 25 page paper. Easy. Essay and short answer exam. Also easy. Interesting guy, very nice. Talks a lot. Class can be very boring sometimes but what can you do

easiest class ever. seriously, the xams are easy as hell b/c he gives you exactly what to review. If you're not sure of the answer, just guess. chances are you'll get it. I got 100% on everything. I think that was the class average. Pretty interesting lectures too. Just go to them, because he grades on participation too.
Take this prof. He is great. Good conversation in class and exams are simple if you go over the reveiw sheet. Easy A.
what an easy ass class. participate in interesting conversations and the exams nobody got less than a 99 on

summary_comment: Professor Brain is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and real-world experience in digital marketing. Students consistently praise his dedication to helping them succeed, his willingness to provide assistance during office hours, and his ability to make complex topics accessible. His engaging and supportive approach fosters a positive learning environment and prepares students well for their future careers.

Ratings.comment: Professor Brain is an outstanding educator who brings a wealth of real-world experience into the Digital Marketing class. Although the web design project may seem challenging but office hours are truly helpful. He is genuinely dedicated to helping his students succeed and provides valuable insights from his own experiences.

Highly recommended if you need a marketing elective course. He is really willing to help students and will teach you a lot of things that are useful for your future career. As long as you attend classes and pay attention to his lecture, you are able to get an A. He is a good grader.

Brian Hipsher is an outstanding professor! He truly cares about his students and creates a very comfortable learning environment. He encourages growth and makes sure to include everyone. He goes above and beyond to make sure that students are involved and know they're material. Overall a top 3 professor in my time here. Highly recommend!

Couldn't recommend Brian more for your marketing elective. Retail Management with him was my favorite class I took at Ohio State. The class is so casual/conversational/and a fun way to learn. Start every class networking with classmates. This created a really connected class. Assignments/tests are easy and he shares a lot of real world experiences.

summary_comment: The professor is highly knowledgeable and effective, delivering a rigorous yet accessible course that closely mimics an MBA experience. Utilizing a Socratic seminar approach with case studies, the class emphasizes practical learning. Assignments are manageable, and grading is relatively lenient, making the course both challenging and supportive.

Ratings.comment: Very intelligent professor, I learned a great deal about practice from him, it was structured more like an MBA class and followed a socratic seminar from case studies framework, assignments weren't terribly difficult and the grading was relatively lenient

summary_comment: Malkoc is an experienced and engaging professor who effectively imparts knowledge in marketing research. Despite challenging pop quizzes, she provides valuable preparation for exams and offers curve adjustments. She is approachable, responsive, and genuinely supportive of her students' success.

Ratings.comment: I really love Malkoc's lectures. She has a lot of experience in the marketing research world and it's so interesting to learn about. Her pop quizzes suck but they are SO useful prepping for exams. She is really nice and really wants her students to do well. She also curves most homework and exams a small portion. Best prof for marketing research!

Good professor, can be tough grader. Frequent pop quizzes. Include ALL info needed for group projects, be as descriptive as possible. A lot of the grade for group work comes from peer evaluations, so do your part. Listen in lectures and attend class. PARTICIPATION IS IMPORTANT! Easily accessible outside of class, and responds to emails quickly

summary_comment: Dr. Norton is a passionate and approachable professor known for his detailed explanations of marketing concepts. However, his classes are exam-heavy, with three exams accounting for 75% of the final grade, making it challenging for students to achieve high marks without extensive study. On the other hand, Dave is described as a very nice and funny professor who is willing to help students, though his lectures are not always effective in preparing students for the difficult exams.

Ratings.comment: Bad professor, very exam heavy (75% of your grade).

Dr. Norton is a passionate teacher who does a good job of explaining the definitions of marketing. His exams were difficult, with averages around 75 for them. Not much homework which is good, but the three exams are 75% of the final grade. Was able to finish with an A through hard work and lots of studying.

Dave is a great professor! His lectures were not always great, but he is such a nice and funny guy. If you approach him with any concerns, he will help you with whatever you need. Make sure to read the textbook and do the SB Assignments. Exams were a little difficult, but nothing crazy. I would take Dave as a professor over anyone else in Fisher.

I want to start off by saying, Dr. Norton is very approachable and seems like a very nice guy. But there is a ton of busy work that will not help your overall grade. Three exams that are worth 75% of your grade... The lecture isn't mandatory and doesn't prepare you for the exams.

Norton is a very cool, personable guy, but this class was unnecessarily difficult. I attended every lecture, read the textbook, completed all the assignments, AND extra credit, and still couldn't score above a C on the exams. The questions are worded poorly and exams are weighted heavily, so there was just no recovery. Effort is not reflected well.
No matter how much you prepare for this course, he somehow creates questions that have nothing to do with the material learned. If I were you, I would find a different professor.
Very nice and funny guy, long lectures but informative.  Most of the work is easy but the tests are worth a lot.  Dave was extremely willing to help his students.
Tests were very difficult.

Norton's class is not bad. Lots of material and memorizing different theories. His exams can be fairly difficult but not impossible so I would make sure you have spent a good amount of time studying. Quirky guy that loves his marketing and I honestly liked his personality because it made for interesting lectures. I recommend him.
Professor Norton is great. He will push you because he cares about the success of his students. Tough, but fair. If you want to get better, take Norton. If you want an easy A, go somewhere else.

His lectures "death by PowerPoint" with no additional information for you to study. He teaches like he is on ted talk and expects you to go along with him and get the whole information. There is no source of reliable information for you to study for exams. I would recommend not signing up for his course if you would want to learn about the basics.

Definitely take him for marketing research! The midterm is definitely harder than the final, but if you attend class, youll be fine! He makes this class really interesting and is very funny! Ive had him for two classes and would take him again if I could!

Not my favorite class, but it was set up in a way where it was bearable. A lot of the quizzes are based on the textbook, while the tests are based on the lectures. Professor Norton seems like a nice enough guy, just be ready to read the textbook.

First thought he was going to be a bad professor because of his syllabus and intro video. States exams go beyond what he teaches, no bad professors just students that dont want to learn etc. However, you could tell was very passionate. The exams weren't as hard as I thought they would be, but you do need to know the material and apply it somewhat

He cares and wants you to do well. A lot of people say his tests are REALLY hard- but I was getting like 70/80s on the quizzes and I got a 94 on the exams so, IDK. He's probably a pretty good in-person prof, he tried really hard to be engaging but it's hard to do online, I think. He's pretty solid though, I'd take him again. DO THE EXTRA CREDIT!
Good overall professor. Exams are challenging, but if you read the textbook, they are manageable.

Dr. Norton was an awesome professor. At first I thought he would be bad due to heavily weighted proctored exams. He says they will be difficult however if you really study for them you should do okay. Not only that, he is a funny guy who really cares about his students. I originally had a B- in the class but with extra credit/curves I pulled an A-.

Dr Norton loves what he teaches, and he takes pride in that his class is hard. He literally says, "Expect exams to be challenging" in the syllabus. It does not help that the exams are proctored and will flag you for reading out the questions. No I am not kidding. While the exams are indeed hard, the lectures and notes he gives you are kinda bad.

Super awesome professor. He really tries to make his lectures interesting and makes marketing kinda fun. Theres an eText book. His tests are a little challenging but if you read the book and listen to the lectures youll be fine. 100% recommend.

I genuinely wish Professor Norton could just sit down and talk about Marketing. Dude tries real hard to make things interesting to students. If you ask him questions you will learn, but I can tell he gets frustrated dealing with students who are only in class for a grade.

Dont get me wrong.... he is a fun dude and seems to care about the course. However his lectures will provide no help on exams. They are way to basic and go into nothing really that is on the exams. Exams are nearly impossible to get an A on. You really have to know the textbook and concepts inside out to get an A. Probably still the best prof.

Dr. Norton is great, makes class fun and relatable! Very responsive. Lectures aren't very helpful though. SO MANY assignments but are usually easy 100%. 2 Exams (heavily weighted, 65% of final grade) covering 10 chapters each, very detailed and not easy at all, however there are curves on them. Extra credit offered. Take him!

Dave is a legend. Makes a two hour lecture feel like 30 minutes. Really funny, caring, and gives great examples. BUT, his midterm and final are a massive chunk of your grade and pretty difficult. He really wants you to understand the material, not just memorize terms. On the plus side, if you do marketing surveys, you'll get 5% extra credit.

Interesting but lengthy lectures - could definitely be more efficient with time and emphasis on important (i.e., tested) topics. Overall, really nice guy with good intentions. He made adjustments to help students with the second half of the course and was very kind and reasonable with expectations.

Kind of a tough class as the only grades are exams and then homework assignments. First exam was tough and professor made great changes that helped me for the second exam. He put in a lot of effort to make sure we did better on the second exam after some rough scores on exam 1! Great guy and makes lectures interesting!

His lectures were hilarious! The grading was really hard though, I studied my ass off for the midterm and final and barely passed them, but he curves when he feels its necessary. A really enjoyable class!

Average on his first midterm was a D+. The highest score was an A-. There is no curve in this class. Do not take this professor if you care at all about your GPA or learning experience. You will not learn anything about marketing besides the common sense that can be learning in econ. The exams are impossible, as shown above. Do not take this prof.

IS this class hard? Yes. A bunch of you are boo-hooing because Dave Norton actually makes you think. Read and Think, not just skim and regurgitate. He cares a ton about his students, but holds them to very high standards. I wish everyone cared as much. Some profs don't push you at all.

1. Go to all extra credit studies to get full allowable extra credit 2. Don't take online as 75% of recorded lectures are impossible to hear/understand due to bad mic 3. Adhere to the book RELIGIOUSLY for definitions, notes, etc. 4. Expect content to be glazed over in lecture, go unmentioned in book, then show up on exam

Dave is an amazing professor! He treats students with respect, but is also very funny and makes class relatable. He is great at explaining topics in a simple and easy to understand manner. You still should read the book to be successful on exams though.

This was his first semester teaching 3250 and we just took the first exam. To his credit, he does tell you that the exam will not be easy. That being said, you can take notes in lectures and do all the reading and you will still be severely unprepared for the exam. There are concepts that are not taught and you have no idea what to expect.
Lectures are long but enjoyable. Funny guy.

Professor Norton is one of the best professors at Fisher. He really takes the time to get to know his students and personally connect with them in class. Lectures are usually very engaging and he makes an effort to make them more interactive. Class is set up with lectures and lab assignments (in groups). I would highly recommend him for any class!
Awesome professor! Super funny. I had him for Market Research and Digital Marketing. Both classes were pretty easy As. Exams are tough, though. Would recommend him to any student.

summary_comment: Prof. Griffin is highly regarded as one of the best professors at Fisher, known for his caring nature and engaging lectures filled with relevant experiences. He effectively encourages student participation, making the new product development class both informative and interactive.

Ratings.comment: Prof. Griffin is one of the best professors I have had in my time at Fisher. He is clearly an incredibly caring professor who shares interesting, applicable experiences in his lectures. If you find anything about new product development interesting, I highly recommend taking the class with this professor. Be prepared to participate in lecture!

summary_comment: Alice is highly regarded as an exceptional professor who genuinely cares about her students' success and makes the class both interesting and engaging. Her clear explanations and practical approach using SPSS make the material relevant and easy to understand, though some find her lectures a bit challenging to follow at times. Students appreciate her kindness and reasonable expectations, and while there can be some ambiguity in assignment requirements, the overall experience is positive and rewarding.

Ratings.comment: Alice is one of the best professors that I have ever had. She really cares about her students and wants what is best for them, so she is super kind and reasonable. Her class is interesting because SPSS is actually useful in the real world. The class wasn't too hard, and she is really smart, so she can explain things well.
Alice's Micro Marketing Data class was a great elective in the SMB-A program. It's very informational, and provides good insight into useful skills in marketing.

Alice is a great professor and clearly cares about the success of her students. She can be a bit difficult to understand at times and the assignment requirements can also be a bit fuzzy. However, as long as you stay engaged with the class and her, this class should be the least of your worries.

Alice is so sweet. I highly recommend taking her class. It is extremely easy to the point of being boring, but Alice makes it still fun to be in class. Pick a good group. You will work with them all semester.

Alice is a great teacher and tries her best to teach the information clearly. The class has group projects which are easy as long as you get a good group. She does not give 100s for many things but most groups still end up getting above a 90. For a stats class, it really isnt difficult. No final, and midterm is open note with a 10 pt curve.

summary_comment: Melissa Fisher is rated as an average professor, known for delivering dry lectures that can be challenging to stay engaged with. Her exams are mostly multiple-choice and generally fair, though some students find certain questions poorly worded. While Fisher is described as nice and clear, her teaching style is often criticized for being overly simplistic and failing to engage more complex learners.

Ratings.comment: To this day, I still quote Melissa Fisher's weird statement in class, "Business people don't read." She was also someone who said "You can only be really good at two things" as a way to promote mastery, but it made absolutely no sense to those great generalists and multi-talented students in the room. There was a lot I had to unlearn from her.

I would rate Ms. Fisher as an average professor based on my experience at OSU.  The lecture material was dry at times, which made it difficult to remain focused.  The exams (all multiple choice) are generally fair, except for a handful of poorly-worded questions.  Go to every lecture and skim through the book for an easily-attainable A.

Nice class. Average exams. I like that the class's grade is entirely made up of exams. Some classes are very inspiring. Some are normal but she is always to the point. Nice, very clear, and a recommended proffesor. I personally found the marketing material very interesting

really not a fun prof or class.  very dry.  write down every example she talks about in class, as well as guest speakers and videos.  many exam questions come from this.  she glosses over concepts, and uses many examples to aid in learning.  but it's a dry class, lectures are a struggle to get through.  no work other than 3 MC exams

Absolutely worthless. Rude when you talk to her in person.  Says we get extra credit through SONA market research, which gets cut in half to start and then we find out at the END that she weights it even further.  Doesnt test on the actual concepts or material, but on random facts about 1 of 5 companies.Talks about her "successes" constantly

Lectures are dry and boring. Her voice cracks constantly and she talks to you like you're a child. I don't doubt she knows the material but she is not great at communicating it. If there are guest speakers or videos in class, go and stay because she makes a lot of exam questinos from them.

I have the International Marketing class with Ms. Fisher. Just like other people said, the class is really easy. The mid-term and the final are all multiple choices. She doesn't give students tricky questions which is good. But I am not agree with others saying that the class is boring. I actually went to every lecture and enjoyed my time there.

I have had her for International marketing and Market Research. She's kind of boring, sometimes has interesting stories. She's really really easy, and has interesting speakers come in. She also really cares about her students and is a great person. She's really nice, and although class can be boring, it's really easy.

Unbearably boring class. Some lectures have 80 some odd slides. She'll skip half of them and totally lose the class in the process. Allows a cheat sheet for tests, so there's really no excuse to do poorly. Not hard, just BORING.

I am currently taking this class, and it is awful. It's very clear this is her first quarter teaching graduate students. She is unorganized, not helpful, and slow to return feedback on assignments and exams. The articles selected for the required $50 coursepack are not relevant to class topics and not covered on the exams. Waste of tuition!

Very easy teacher and she is very nice. There are a couple quizzes which are easy and the exams are the exact same just more questions. you get to use a cheat sheet on quizzes and exams. no need to buy textbook. Group project is very very easy. Take her!

So far she is really easy. There is a midterm and final, and a quiz the class prior to each covering the same material. You can use a page front and back of notes on the quizzes and exams. So far the group project seems pretty easy. She is really nice.

summary_comment: This professor is renowned for delivering a challenging yet highly rewarding experience, particularly in senior year. Students consistently praise the hands-on, project-based approach that leads to significant learning and practical applications, though they note the intense workload and critical feedback style. Despite the difficulty, the majority agree that the class is invaluable and stands out as one of the best educational experiences at OSU.

Ratings.comment: The toughest and the best class at OSU. Worked on a semester long project for Legal Aid Services. Made a real difference in the world! Got a chance to apply my college education.
Take this class in your senior year with Matta. He pushes you and your team real hard but you come away with real learning. Toughest class by far but very doable. His class is totally worth it. Word.

Real tough. Best class I took in Marketing and in college. I learned more than all other marketing professors taught me. My group members complained that he was critical in our group meetings but he was telling us the truth. No sugar coating. In the end, we were one of two groups who scored the highest. This is the class that stands out.

The project with Baggallini brand handbags and travel bags will be a highlight of my college degree. I spoke about the project in two job interviews already. Matta is the toughness professor I had at Ohio State. He is also the best professor I had. He pushed you to your best potential. I am glad professors like him still exist.

I worked on a team project for a handbag brand. It was the toughest project I've done in college. I learned the most and learned more than I did in all four years of college. It's your chance to learn real marketing!
I absolutely hated this class and I feel bad for the people who have to have this professor their second semester of senior year. Good luck.. you'll need it.
Want to learn? Take his class. Want to slack off? Don't take it. Want a real teacher? Take his class. I did and it was the best decision of my senior year.

Very tough! His 4204 class is project-based and it will consume your life for the semester. He requires weekly meetings with each team and is very critical of your work.  However, I learned a great deal and have something to show for it. I'm able to use my final presentation for interviews. Take if you want to learn, not if you want to slack off.

Semester long group project with a brand/company and my group was Foot Petals. I learned more out of this than any other class. Can come across as mean and pushes you to do better. You spend around 10-15 hours a week working on the project. You can't miss any group or class meeting with him for any reason. Thankfully, he is fair with grades.
Toughest class that I just got done with. Team project for Foot Petals brand. I've learned the most in this class than in all other classes in my four years. Tough but worth every minute.

Global Marketing class and we got to go to Singapore! Toughest class and toughest professor but we had so much fun. After presenting to the executive team of a global company in Singapore, I was on top of the world. Search for this class and take it. Don't miss it!

I worked in a team on a full semester project. It was a very hard project but was very useful in my job interviews. This class taught me more than any other class at Ohio State. He is funny, tough and very direct. This is THE class at THE Ohio State University.
Hands down the best class I took at OSU. Tough, enjoyable and I will remember it for a long time. If you really want to learn and not just go through college like most do, this is the professor.

A semester long project. The final report is a 50-page booklet. Never thought that I could accomplish such thing. You have to use indesign or photoshop. Keeps asking questions and never satisfies with the answers. Good thing is the grade is fine.

It's just his acting of being "scary." To push you to achieve your extreme. Very terrible experience but learned a lot. Toughest class ever. BE PREPARED. C is considered as D in his standard, so you'll at least  get a B. You'll feel the tense everytime going to his project coaching time. 5 classes in total but have to meet him in a group every week
Inspirational class

To those who say he's "mean":  I've had him for 4 classes and I never saw him be "mean" to those who read the material well enough to speak intelligently on it.  Please understand that "mean" is actually "challenges you."  If you want to do well in the competitive business world, he'll have you very well prepared for tough Sr managers.

A lot of people think he's mean. I think they take what he says too personally. He's just trying to make the class more interesting. I would take his class ANY day over one of the other boring lectures at Fisher. He doesn't just read off his powerpoints. He knows what he's talking about. I got a B without reading the book. I highly recommend.
Very mean, Unprofessional, rude, and teaches like he is talking to some tweens in highschool. He might have a lot of industry experience but a teacher should not marginalize his students.

He made taking class on Friday afternoon very enjoyable. The best professor I've had at OSU. Very knowledgeable and has a ton of industry experience. He will give you honest feedback. Much better than every other class where students don't participate and professors don't care. If you love Marketing, this is the best class.

Dr. Matta is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. He is very tough on his students. Some who are over sensitive may say he comes across as mean, but if you get to know him he is a very nice guy. Exams were manageable, a lot of work outside this class. If you actually want to learn something take this class with Matta
Meanest professor in fisher. Picked on a handicap student. Has a weird thing for taking guys pictures

This guy is sooo mean. He puts the whole class down.But, I most admit he does know his stuff is a very knowledgeable professor, however, it's hard to like him because he put you down. His exams are really hard,class is not mandatory, but if you want a good grade go to class and dont sit close to him if you dont want to look dumb in front of class..

Smart but mean, Matta knows his material and demands the same from the class. His humor usually comes at someone else's expense, and while attendance is necessary for info that should be in the book anyway, he's not above witholding it if he's displeased with the class. Don't take if you can't put up with such people or forced attendance.

Without a doubt the funniest professor I've ever had. Lectures were 2hr long but he made them entertaining. Very knowledgable and helpful. Assignments were all online and easy, gave out a lot of EC opportunities, tests were reasonable. Highly recommended.

Wants class participation but puts down students who give an incorrect answer, thereby providing no incentive to participate. Humor style is to make fun of students. Lecture is easy to follow, and he offers insightful information and excellent examples. Provides slides for notes; does not allow technology. Is definitely tough but unreasonably mean.
The BEST professor at Fisher and also in all of my OSU classes. He cares for his students. He is tough but he is also the best. Take his class and you will really learn Marketing
I was in his projects class this semester and I learned more in this class than all four years combined. Very tough but the best class. Take it with Matta!
Take him if you want to feel bad all the time. He was never satisfied with his students.

Very tough professor, and hard tests. If you want to chill out your senior year do not take his class. It was a very awful experience. You have to read every word on the text book before come to class. He will call your name and ask you the questions. If you answer it wrong he will give you the look.

The best marketing class at Fisher. I took Matta's class in 2011 and we had a cool brand campaign project for OSU. We presented to Gordon Gee. It rocked. The best learning experience.Take this class if you can.
Matta seems to be severe, but gives everyone B+ at least. NO NEED TO BUY THE BOOK. He tells his students to work on it, but never actually uses it.

This is the best class I took at Fisher and at OSU. The live project with JWT was awesome. It is a very demanding class, but also the one in which you learn the MOST. Matta is the best. Do not graduate from Fisher without Matta's class.

Challenging class, you spend a lot of time working on group project with is very valuable... However; professor Matta is rude & disrespectful to his students. In regards to the group project, you present an ad campaign to an ad firm which he creates.  It's like he still wants to be in the field not allowing students to think for themselves.

Great teacher! Learned so much would recommend him to anyone. The exams are pretty tough but curved. The project is very time consuming and challenging but very rewarding afterward. Shashi is the man.

2 quizzes which are actually 50 question midterms. very difficult but he curves, do not need to read the book. 2 papers (our second one was cancelled). Paper turned out to be 15 pages long, very difficult prompt. project is very difficult, you will ahve to meet with your group and professor a lot. essentially, you have 1 week to pull the proj toget
Awesome class. Lots to learn. Tough Class, but worth every minute.
Best Teacher in Fisher Marketing program. TAKE PROF. MATTA for 755, it will be the most you learn in  a class through out ALL of college.
This man is the best teacher I had at OSU. The final project is helpful and relevant, and he actually legitimately enjoys teaching and cares about his students. TAKE 755 WITH MATTA.

THIS IS THE BEST CLASS I HAVE TAKEN AT FISHER. DON'T MISS THIS CLASS WITH SHASHI MATTA IF YOU ARE A MARKETING MAJOR! 755 IS TAUGHT BY OTHERS TOO, BUT I THINK HE'S THE BEST. HE IS TOUGH BUT CLASSES ARE A LOT OF FUN AND LEARNING. I USED A LOT OF WHAT I LEARNED IN 755 IN MY INTERVIEWS. HE IS VERY HELPFUL WITH RECO LETTERS TOO. GOT FOR IT.

I took ML 755 in Spring 2007. It was the best experience in terms of a classroom course at OSU. I am not a business student but took this class because I wanted to learn about advertising. This class was just awesome. He handled the JWT project and students very professionally. I learned more in this class than in any other class.

Worst class in the business college. This guy presents you with ad campaigns he worked on in the past, and asks for the classes opinion on them. If anyone says anything negative he grills you. He's very arrogant and no one learns anything because by the end no one wants to say anything because no matter what you say your usually wrong. AVOID!!!
The best classI have taken at OSU, along with Prof. Bendapudi's class. This is REAL learning. The JWT project is on my resume. Excellent class. take it if you have the chance, with Matta.

This was the BEST class I have taken at Fisher. Prof. Matta is amazing. he come across as very tough, but his class is awesome and I have learned the most in his class. The final project with JWT rocked! He has first-hand knowledge in Advertising and makes the class really great. I wish Fisher had more professors like him. Great prof!

the worst professor i've ever had at fisher.  seems to think that his class is all that matters in the world, and even instituted a policy making students who came late to class or had to use the restroom sing for 2 min.   you'll probably get an ok grade but its an absolutely miserable experience.  Overall very arrogant and rude.

Makes the class look hard but I don't think anyone got anything lower than a B on anything. Makes Participation mandatory and says their are no wrong answers and then laughs, or makes fun of you if it is not what he wants to hear.
Not much experience teaching? Can be rather abrupt in responding to students' comments. (amusing but takes away from participation) Quizzes were relatively easy. Don't bother buying the book.

summary_comment: The professor's teaching quality is uneven, with the first half of the class being straightforward but the latter half challenging due to complex R code that was not well-explained. Despite this, students generally receive high grades as long as they put in significant effort.

Ratings.comment: This was the last class for the Business Analytics Minor. The first half was easy, all we did was create a survey. The second half was a lot of difficult R code and it wasn't explained very well in class. He forgets that we are undergrad students and do not know much statistics or R. Everyone will end with an A or A- if they put in the effort.

summary_comment: Professor Leslie Fine is known for her rigorous and demanding approach, often described as challenging and unforgiving. Students find her grading strict and subjective, with little leeway for improvement without excelling in group work and homework. Her teaching style is direct but can be harsh and demotivating, making the learning environment less supportive.

Ratings.comment: Make sure to clarify tasks with her.  Not always clear on what she deems as acceptable.  Shows no examples and expects a lot.  Is very direct, but can be extremely mean and blunt which is not conducive to growth as a student.

she is very clear in how she conveys the information, however the questions on the quizzes (only 5 questions) are quite confusing and sometimes don't make sense.  Take notes during class and read the cases carefully

The first day of class took place on the day of the Ohio State 2015 National Championship Game in Dallas. She sent an email out a few days before saying if you miss class, you will be dropped. No excuses. That says all you need to know about Leslie Fine. Stay Away!

She really demands your best and is a very difficult grader, so if you do happen to please her then you feel like you've really accomplished something, but its very hard to do so. Her feedback can be downright scathing and super critical sometimes. It's not a very enjoyable class.

Prof. Fine is probably one of the toughest graders in Fisher. She bases her grades solely on her likings and fails to provide enough information throughout the projects to improve your work. Work is solely group based and heavily weighs on a peer evaluation. If you want a good grade hope you get a good group- she assigns them.

Leslie is such an awful prof. She is one of the hardest graders I've had in class- not taught what you're graded on with homeworks and nit picks presentations. She changed the grading scale to make it harder to get an A! Take the class with someone else

You are graded on 7 group homeworks and 1 final, which is over the materials covered in the entire semester in DETAIL. The final grade is scaled down, so 90 would only be B+. You really have to do the homeworks well so that you have more room for mistakes for the final. You'll definitely need it. There was no extra credit.

The class itself isn't that bad, but Leslie can be a bit of a buzz kill. She expects everyone to read every case and be as into it as her. The 2 quizzes (which are essentially a midterm and final) are based on the cases and class discussion, so to do well you need to read all the cases (which can be brutal) and actively listen/participate in class.

she is never satisfied with the work you present to her, also she grades really hard. exam is not to hard but you have to study a lot for it she will test you on very very small details of the class discussion. avoid if possible. 1 Paper, 2 exams,3 presentations

Awful teacher. Tested on material not covered in class or in text. On a power trip the whole time. One of the worst teachers at Fisher. Always grumpy and useless. I didn't learn a thing in the class. Seriously don't waste your time. Everyone I talked to in my class felt the same way about her this quarter.

Leslie is a really nice teacher. And the class brought about some very interesting discussions at times. However the nuts and bolts of the class were suspect. Nothing forward looking, it was 3 months of doing postmortems on other companies and other cases...been nice to construct a marketing plan thats not based on the 1990's. Why? Its 2009...

She was a really fun teacher.  I thought her class was pretty easy as long as you came to class and read the book before the test.  She really didn't try to trick you but she wanted you to do the work.

One of the nicest Professors.  Kept class interesting and didn't just sit there and read off slides.  Gave lots of real world examples and made the class fun.  Great Professor and would highly recommend!

I loved this class...one huge presentation... helped us by having us do an actual marketing plan and actually presenting to the CEO and director of Marketing. Super nice...very short and loud, but really knows her stuff. I loved this class

Good class.. 2 Presentations and 2 exams. Easy to get A if you work hard on presentations.  You don't need a book and you pretty much only buy Harvard Business cases. Leslie is very nice. She is pretty short, but LOUD.

summary_comment: This professor offers flexible grade distribution options, making it easy to tailor your grade based on your strengths. Exams are straightforward, with all relevant material clearly presented in class discussions, powerpoints, and the textbook. While some exams require thorough preparation, the overall class is highly engaging with practical content and hands-on experiments.

Ratings.comment: Easy exams as long as you pay attention to class discussions or read the material outside of class. Everything that is on the exams are in the book and powerpoints, no trick questions. Class content is easy to understand and very applicable to your life. Engaging experiments for class credit. You get to decide your grade distribution. A+ Class!

You get to choose your contribution of the grade. Such as 10% for participation and 30% for each exam. You can also choose 0% for participation and more percent for assignments or exams. Her exams are not easy, you really need to learn from the power points and the book.

summary_comment: Professor Zantedeschi is highly regarded for his deep knowledge and brilliance in the subject matter, though his thick Italian accent can make his lectures challenging to follow. His assessments, while formatted as multiple-choice questions, require detailed explanations for credit, which can be confusing. Despite this, students find him very approachable and helpful during office hours.

Ratings.comment: Professor Zantedeschi seems brilliant, but he has a thick Italian accent that makes him hard to understand. Also, his quizzes and tests are formatted as multiple choice, but makes you explain your answer for credit. He thinks he teaches us a lot of things, but doesn't and still quizzes us on them. Very accessible for office hours though.

summary_comment: Professor Max is an effective instructor who prioritizes understanding over memorization, making statistics accessible through clear PowerPoint presentations and office hours. His classes are generally easy with minimal homework, focusing on exams, labs, and a group project. However, students note significant grading delays and find the course content, particularly the group project, to be time-consuming and sometimes frustrating.

Ratings.comment: Professor Max is one of my favorite professors. He wants everyone to do well and makes sure anything statistics-related is understandable. Grade is based on participation, 3 exams (curves), 3 labs (in pairs), and a final group project (about 8-10 pages) along with a group presentation. Book is NOT necessary, exams only cover PowerPoint material.

Max never grades anything. You don't know with any accuracy where you stand in the class. He takes two-three weeks to grade scantron exams and still hasn't graded our submission from the first week of class (it is the second to last day of finals). May not seem like a huge deal now, but wait till you take him. Also a VERY unnecessary group paper.

Max is a pretty good instructor overall.  The class content is extremely boring, but he does a nice job teaching it.  Attendance is mandatory but he allows 4 skips without hurting your grade, and there are 3 weeks of labs that are optional for attendance.   Exams aren't too hard. Group project isn't too hard.  Textbook not needed
Boring class but nice teacher. You may think the lecture is easy but you might not really know how to apply to exam. You'll survive without reading the book, but for better grades, better read it.

His class was boring-not because of his teaching, but because of the statistics material.  There's no way to make learning about conducting focus groups and creating marketing research proposals fun.  He gives great feedback and encourages you to come to his office hours for help on the material and final project.

Great guy. Funny too. Class was pretty easy. Study the slides for the exam and go over the practice exam. One big group project but it was easy. No homework really. Max was a great teacher. No need to buy the book.

summary_comment: This professor is generally well-regarded for his dedication to his content and students. Lectures are crucial for success, and he offers multiple opportunities for extra credit and participation points. However, tests can be challenging, with specific questions that require thorough preparation. Overall, students find his courses engaging and would recommend him.

Ratings.comment: LISTEN/WATCH the lectures and you will pass

Generally a good professor. Cares a lot about his content and his students. Tests are somewhat challenging, the final paper is a little easier but kind of length.  Gives out extra credit almost randomly, even if you attend and do well you might not ever get any.

Blair was a nice guy.  The material in the class was actually pretty interesting.  He gives multiple opportunities for extra credit and participation points.  His tests aren't impossible, but he asks very specific questions that you might not recall from lectures.  I would take him again.

Although the classes are mandatory because participation points, Professor Kidwell keeps them interesting and fun! I loved this course and would highly recommend him. The exams are not particularly tough but study beyond the guide. He works with the students and extends deadlines, if needed. Great guy!

Taught as an intro to psych class; there’s minimal applied Marketing strategy. Exams are much harder than the material covered, and expects you to know more in-depth information about concepts than he teaches. The book this semester didn't line up with what he taught either. He gives participation points and assignments to help boost your grade.

summary_comment: Professor West's teaching approach varies widely according to student feedback. Some found her class manageable and interesting, praising her fairness and willingness to offer extra credit, while others criticized her strictness, perceived unfair grading, and confusing class structure. Overall, opinions are divided, with some students achieving high grades through minimal effort, while others struggled due to the demanding nature of the course.

Ratings.comment: Based on earlier ratings, it seems she changed the class. 2 exams - no cheat sheets. You need to go to class and read the text to do well.
