It wasn't hard, and I thought she was nice and the class was interesting. 3 group projects, 1 individual project. Opportunities for extra credit on both exams.

She was not a good teacher.Even though you did well on everything, you may still get "so-so"grade because she was not fair to all students. She gave better grade to someone not because of the better performance but she liked that student. I would not success choosing her.

Great class! Easy A! Literally, if you can BS then you are good. The midterm was a joke - you get to use a one page study guide with anything you write on it. I didn't have to take the final because I got above a 90% on the midterm. The report for the project, seriously, BS around the details and you'll get a good grade. I got 100%. Take her class!

Professor West is a great teacher. Get to know her and it will help tremendously. Also, if your unsure of anything just ask her. It does demand work by the student but your grade will reflect your effort.

I thought she was great! I got a 99 on the midterm and didn't have to take the final! I thought she was pretty fair...the only people who complained were those who didn't do well on the midterm...but that's their fault since I was in the same class and did fine...

She was not a good teacher. Her family was much more important than the class. I did well (100%) on everything but the midterm and she made up policies as she went that we not fair to all students. I would not success taking her.
I wasn't a fan of prof. west, she is very strict in class, gets angry if you get up to use the restroom or get water.  There was a big group project that isn't discussed much at all in class.

I didn't like Professor West. She kept saying she set up the class so we would learn, but I have had so many better professor than her. The layout of the class didn't make logical sense..she had us do a big project before we even read about how to do it in the text book. And she crammed a bunch of work into the 2nd half of the course.

She is a great teacher. She is very enthusiastic about the material and very helpful to talk to outside of class as well.  She lets you post potential exam questions on Carmen and then will pick some for the tests.  Although, for the final she hardly used any of the questions we posted, although the average for the final was a 90 anyway.
Patricia West is a great instructor for this class. If you have the chance, take her instead of Shashi Matta. She is extremely helpful and you will learn a lot.

I really liked her.  There were a lot of projects, but she ended up making the final optional (you used your midterm score). The projects were interesting, and she was always very helpful if you asked. A fair grader on her midterms, make sure you post good questions because she uses them in the exam! (and study the others)

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for their engaging and effective teaching style, particularly in marketing cases. They provide extensive real-world examples and interactive discussions, making the course comparable to an MBA-level experience. However, the class requires significant preparation with frequent presentations and discussions, and opinions vary, with some finding it challenging while others consider it the best teaching experience at The Ohio State University.

Ratings.comment: An excellent instructor for the topic- Marketing cases. Gives plenty of real world examples from his consulting gig and makes it come to life. Makes it feel like an MBA course doing HBS case studies and the volume of presentations and reports that have to be submitted in. Highly recommended for anyone in the Marketing program to take his class
Great professor and even better person!

GREAT TEACHER! Rolled a dice each class to see which group presented the info. If they didn't cover it well enough he'd roll again, and so on. Then he would have a great discussion about the topic to complete anything left out and the how and why.

Easy class! No Exams! Be prepared every day to do a presentation though, cause he picks groups at random. Read the cases, most are pretty interesting. Be prepared for his tough questions during your presentation...
Easy.  Nice guy, will give you help if you ask for it.  No exams, just read the cases and be prepared to discuss.

Awesome teacher!  No exams!  Just show up in class having done the 10-15 page reading that he assigned and then discuss it for 1.5 hours.  Really teaches the material well without having students learn useless stuff to take exams.  By far the best teacher at The Ohio State University!
WORST EVER... DIDN'T LEARN A THING FROM HIM.  But we got out super early each class.  Waste of your time and money.  Take other M&L electives if possible.
Great teacher, easy and makes the subject very interesting.
BEST professor I have ever had.  I learned sooo much for him and the workload was not difficult.  He was able to give us real world knowledge. HIGHLY recommended!

summary_comment: Karthik is an exceptionally engaging and motivating professor, consistently praised for his ability to make classes enjoyable and interesting. Students find him highly helpful, fair, and funny, with many considering him one of the best teachers they have encountered. His teaching style is clear and supportive, making the material accessible and the exams straightforward for those who engage with the readings.

Ratings.comment: karthik is a very engaging lecturer.  I looked forward to class and enjoyed each topic.
Karthik is one of my favorite teachers in marketing
best prof ever. extremely helpful. very funny. really engaging. extremely fair grader - just read the book and you'll be fine.
Good teacher. Very easy material and exams are easy if you read the chapters and review. Not confusing at all. The project is time consuming but interesting.
Agreed, very motivational prof
A very engaging prof, made class very interesting. Always helpful when you ask for extra help, and clearly very excited about the class he's teaching. Great teacher, definitely recommended

summary_comment: Ebbes is highly regarded as one of Fisher's best professors, known for delivering engaging and practical lessons that include real-world projects and examples, which significantly enhance students' interest in market research. His unique Dutch accent is seen as an added charm rather than a barrier. Students strongly recommend taking his classes.

Ratings.comment: Ebbes is one of Fisher's BEST professors and an all-around great guy. He provides REAL-WORLD projects and examples that will really spark anyone's interest in market research. He has a Dutch accent but that adds to the fun of class. TAKE EBBES.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as one of the worst teachers, known for creating an arbitrary grading rubric at the end of the quarter without providing feedback throughout the course. Classes were unprepared, and students felt unsure of their evaluations. The professor's lack of commitment to teaching was evident, leading many to believe they should not be permitted to instruct again.

Ratings.comment: The worst teacher I have ever had in my entire life. Made entirely new grading rubric at the end of the quarter and didn't tell you any grades until then. Wasn't prepared for class and you never knew how you were being evaluated on work. Didn't care about teaching and shouldn't be allowed to teach ever again. Waste of my time.

summary_comment: The professor is described as fun and laid-back, focusing on real-world applications and group case studies, making the class enjoyable but light on traditional lecture content. While some students found the class easy and entertaining, others criticized it for lacking depth and relevance, with the professor relying heavily on outdated examples and opinions.

Ratings.comment: Fun, very laid back teacher.  You work in groups on three case studies, and you write three case study reports, but they can be in bullet point form. He likes talking about recent newspaper articles that have to do with marketing topics.  Good class.

A good ol' boy from past biz era, he rather talk about business articles, than blabber on about the fundamentals of marketing. Actual class lecture lasted 30 min max. We watched lots of commercials--made class entertaining but not necessary to attend.
Talk about easy and a half.
Class was not based on a textbook, it was "real-world" based. Enjoyable lectures because they were mostly other students presenting on cases. 3 case presentations and 1 final. Good class overall!

Mr. Dunaj's class wasn't good.  His teaching was based on opinions, which were usually wrong when compared to reputable research.  His examples were mostly outdated.  He taught every lecture using the book slides which were online and every test was a book test (mult choice.)  There was no value in going to the lectures beyond participation credit.

summary_comment: The professor has mixed reviews, with some students finding him approachable and helpful, while others describe his lectures as confusing and his exams extremely difficult. Some students found the class manageable with consistent effort, while others warn against taking the course due to its challenging nature and low average scores. Overall, the professor's teaching style and exam difficulty vary widely according to student perception.

Ratings.comment: nice guy. attendance and participation mandatory. 2 somewhat difficult midterms b+ class avgs and a group project. I read and went to class and it was easy
One of the best professors i have ever had. Great help in and out of the classroom. Pretty easy as well. Highly recommend.

Years past retirement date. Most painful experience in a classroom at Ohio State. You want to shoot him or yourself every class. Exams are 50 of the worst questions ever, and he probably would do the same as the class average <50%. Don't take this class.
He makes me want to shoot myself in the head after every lecture - no clue what he is talking about!
Nice guy but very boring and NOT organized...dont buy the book, he doesnt follow it, students who did follow text did worse on the test then those who didnt.

The material covered is not difficult; however, his tests are really hard.  Most of the test is trying to figure out exactly what he is asking.  The average on the first exam was a 44%, which he didn't think was that bad.  A good question for him to ask on the final is "why am I still teaching?"
The most boring professor i have even had.

Very unhelpful instructor who would rather have his own way than helping students.  Do not try to discuss validility of exam questions with this instructor because you'll waste your time.  He purposely makes his exams to fool you.
